title: Phishing Simulation – SWG Audit
description: Test perimeter security against credential theft. Phishing simulation levels: zero‑hour, URL spoofing, credential submission block.
keywords: SWG Audit, phishing test, credential theft, zero‑hour, URL spoofing, perimeter security
headline: Validate the real-world effectiveness of your perimeter security against Phishing
subline: Phishing campaigns exploit URL reputation evasion?Techniques to bypass blocklists by using new domains, URL shorteners, or legitimate-but-compromised websites. The malicious intent isn't apparent from the URL alone. and reverse proxy?An intermediary server that forwards requests to the real target. Used in phishing to capture credentials in real-time while proxying to the legitimate site, bypassing MFA. techniques. Credentials and session cookies are stolen even with MFA?Multi-Factor Authentication — requires multiple verification methods (password + code). Reverse proxy attacks can bypass this by stealing the session token after successful authentication.. Attackers register lookalike domains, get them categorised as safe, then deploy a phishing kit in the zero‑hour window?The time period after a new threat appears but before security vendors add it to their blocklists. Can last hours or days, leaving organizations vulnerable..
instructions: Configure URL filters to block phishing websites, while allowing swgaudit.com for testing.
